SymptomDefinition.name: Restrict port-level configuration overrides on VDS
SSL certificate should be issued by a trusted certificate authority on the SDDC Manager
VDS network healthcheck for Teaming Health Check is enabled
ESXi.config-snmp - SNMP service is running
Unity push feature is enabled
NSX Manager''s ''CLI Timeout'' is not set to recommended value.
Logging-servers are not configured with log level as "INFO".
Unity taskbar feature is enabled
vSphere Authentication Proxy not used for password protection when adding ESXi hosts to active directory
vSAN cluster encryption is not enabled.
Management Service in context is ''syslog''.
Virtual HD audio card connected
vCenter.set-file-based-backup-recovery - File-Based Backup and Recovery is not Configured
VM.disable-console-gui-options - Copy/paste operations are activated
vCenter.set-remote-logging - Remote logging is not enabled
VM.disable-unexposed-features-unity-taskbar - Unity taskbar feature is activated
ESXi.set-cimsfcb-watchdog-policy-off - The SFCBD Watch dog service policy is On
Informational messages from the VM to the VMX file are not limited
HGFS file transfers are enabled

Management Service in context is ''async_replicator''
Firewall is not configured to restrict few or all services running on ESXi host
VM.Enable-VGA-Only-Mode Configure system security parameters - Deactivate all but VGA mode on specific virtual machines

Logical Router has OSPF configured.

The number of retained VM diagnostic logs is not set to the recommended value

Router Type is TIER0

Recommendation.Description: Fix the DISA Hardening Guide Rules Violations for vSphere for the vSphere Distributed Virtual Switch according to the recommendations available at DISA.
Fix the DISA Hardening Guide Rules Violations for vSphere for the VMwareAdapter Instance (vCenter) according to the recommendations available at DISA.
Fix the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard 4.0 for VirtualAndPhysicalSANAdapter Instance violations according to the recommendations available at PCI DSS.
Fix the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard 3.2.1 for vSphere violations according to the recommendations available at PCI DSS.
Fix the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard 4.0 for vSphere for the VMwareAdapter Instance (vCenter) violations according to the recommendations available at PCI DSS.
Fix the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard 4.0 for vSphere Distributed Port Group violations according to the recommendations available at PCI DSS.
Fix the vSphere Security Configuration Guide Rules Violations according to the recommendations available at vSphere Security Configuration Guide.
Fix the DISA Hardening Guide Rules Violations for vSphere for the vSphere Distributed Port Group according to the recommendations available at DISA.
Fix the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard 3.2.1 for vSphere violations according to the recommendations available at PCI DSS.
Fix the NSX Security Configuration Guide Rules Violations according to the recommendations available at NSX Security Configuration Guide
Fix the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard 3.2.1 for vSphere violations according to the recommendations available at PCI DSS.
Fix the DISA Hardening Guide Rules Violations for vSphere for the ESXi Host according to the recommendations available at DISA.
Fix the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard 3.2.1 for vSphere violations according to the recommendations available at PCI DSS.
Fix the DISA Hardening Guide Rules Violations for vSphere for the Virtual Machine according to the recommendations available at DISA.
Fix the vSphere Security Configuration Guide Rules Violations according to the recommendations available at vSphere Security Configuration Guide.
Fix the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard 3.2.1 for vSphere violations according to the recommendations available at PCI DSS.
Fix the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard 4.0for vSphere for the Virtual Machine violations according to the recommendations available at PCI DSS.
Fix the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard 4.0 for vSphere for the ESXi Host violations according to the recommendations available at PCI DSS.
Fix the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard 4.0 for vSphere for the vSphere Distributed Virtual Switch violations according to the recommendations available at PCI DSS.
